content.body: Chris de Almeida: It turns out that I was able to add the event myself at least to the private calendar by inviting it with its calendar id.
content.formatted_body: Chris de Almeida: It turns out that I was able to add the event myself at least to the private calendar by inviting it with its calendar id.

content.body: So I guess its access control is currently working thanks to security by obscurity.
It looks like the public calendar doesn't auto-accept invites.

> <@eemeli:mozilla.org> Chris de Almeida: It turns out that I was able to add the event myself at least to the private calendar by inviting it with its calendar id.

generally what will happen when you do this, is that the meeting will disappear some time later

content.body: I deleted mine, but you might want to update to use the built-in google meet
also updated to add the public calendar
I asked eemeli, and he said that people invited via another invite have the meeting id
so he prefers to use the original one
i changed the settings on the calendar
ah sure, if he's keeping that calendar item, then g2g
it will no longer show invites, but i suppose we could have someone accepting those invites and then they would show up
we can discuss this during facilitation planning

in spec language, if you have an AO with arguments (_required_, [ _optional_ ]), can you pass the absent argument to another AO where it is also optional? e.g. Perform OtherOperation(_required_, _optional_)
content.formatted_body: in spec language, if you have an AO with arguments (required, [ optional ]), can you pass the absent argument to another AO where it is also optional? e.g. Perform OtherOperation(required, optional)

content.body: or do you have to do something like this? If _optional_ is present, perform OtherOperation(_required_, _optional_). Else, perform OtherOperation(_required_).
content.formatted_body: or do you have to do something like this? If optional is present, perform OtherOperation(required, optional). Else, perform OtherOperation(required).

content.body: i have always done the latter
i think it is too confusing if _optional_ is present in the text, but actually means "perfect forwarding"
content.formatted_body: i think it is too confusing if optional is present in the text, but actually means "perfect forwarding"
